panama.core
Class Context

java.lang.Object
  panama.core.Context

public class Context
extends java.lang.Object

Provides methods to access application scope, session scope, request scope and parameters. Wrapper for Velocity.Context and more. Do not use all uppercase keys, they should be reserved for predefined content

Author:
Robert

createInstance

public static Context createInstance(Dispatcher core,
                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpSession sess,
                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res,
                                     java.util.Locale defaultLocale)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Static creator - created Context is stored in threadlocal variable and may be accessed via getInstance()

Parameters:
core - Dispatcher
sess - Session
req - Request
res - Response
defaultLocale - Locale derived vom supported and accepted locales (app res. browser)
Returns:
newly created instance.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if creating the hibernateSupportClass

getLocale

public java.util.Locale getLocale()
Gets Locale to use. If one is explicity set via setLocale(Locale) it is returned, otherwise a default Locale derived from the supported-languages setting and the accepted languages (and it's order) from the user's browser is returned.

Returns:
a Locale that matches best what the user wants and the application can provide.

setLocale

public void setLocale(java.util.Locale locale)
Explizitly set a Locale to use.

Parameters:
locale - The locale to use.

getLocalizedString

public java.lang.String getLocalizedString(java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.Object... args)
Gets localized string for specified key and optional args, based on default resource bundle (resources.properties and it's variations for other languages like resources_de.properties) and current locale. e.g. hello = Hello {1}! getResource("hello", "World") -> Hello World!

Parameters:
key -
args - values for placesholders in resource value.
Returns:
the formatted string

getLocalizedString

public java.lang.String getLocalizedString(java.lang.String bundleName,
                                           java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.Object... args)
Gets localized string for specified key and optional args, based on specified resource bundle and current locale.

Parameters:
bundleName - name of resource bundle to use
key -
args - values for placesholders in resource value.
Returns:
the formatted string

buildParameterMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object> buildParameterMap(java.lang.String... paramsAndValues)
Builds parameter Map from list of parameter and value elements.

Parameters:
paramsAndValues - a variable list of parameters and values, alternating like so: param1, value1, param2, value2...; These replace the original parameters during the execution of the action.
Returns:
a Map, mapping parameters to values
